name: Premiere Classe Roissy-Villepinte-Parc des Expositions

reviews.text: If you are on a budget, this place may be a good choice. It's quite easy and inexpensive to get to form both CDG airport and Paris city centre. The bus from the airport stops just in front of the building and RER train station is very close too. The room itself was rather small but clean and beds were comfy. Best of all the price was unbeatable for quality provided. If you consider staying in a hostel, consider these budget hotels too. Even with transportation costs it was cheaper and better than hostel. Would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Great value for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel for an overnight stop close to Charles de Gaulle airport and almost skipped by this one because the listed price appeared to be too good to be true (i.e. less than $37 for a room for 2 people). The reviews were OK but we were still skeptical, but decided to book anyway - it was just one night after all. There was no need to worry, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The front desk is not staffed at all times, but is serviced by the adjacent hotel next door when no-one is there. Being situated on the edge of the Parc des Expositions there is not much in the way of restaurants etc in the immediate area. There's a restaurant in the hotel next door which was good but a little pricey. Location is about a block away from a train station for CDG or Paris.
reviews.title: Amazing value

reviews.text: had to travel into paris to eat. and train ride costsa 7.60euro return so its pricey. but hotel room is cheapest i found with private bathroom. bathroom si so small, not for full figured people at all. otherwise you cannot shower or even brush your teeth properly. reminds me of being in a plane's bathroom. clean ghotel. nice room. staff on all 3 occasions ignored me for the most part, asked for a wake up call that never came. i used their left luggage service which was leaving my bag in a room which was unlocked and my baggage was not given a tag or anything, and anyone could have walked out with it. fine for a stopover. 10 mins by rail to charles de gaulle airport. had to walk 15-20min to get to food (mcdonalds etc).
reviews.title: stayed for 3 separate nights because its so close to airport. but not much food around

reviews.text: The hotel is cheap and you get what you pay for. I needed somewhere to sleep before my fliffy and it was good for that.
reviews.title: It's cheap and near CDG.

reviews.text: 2 friends and I were planning a 10 day trip with Paris as our first stop. With a limited budget we found this hotel on Priceline. I will say for the $45 a night that it is worth it's value. The hotel is situated only 1 block from the main RER train into the city so we used that. However the ticket will run you 8euros each way (unless you "jump" the turnstiles....shhhhhhh). If you are staying overnight on a layover it's fine cause it's only a 3euro ride back to the airport - a much better deal than the 18euro taxicab ride we took from the airport on our first day!!!!
reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night as was going to the Parc des Expo very nearby. Cost was £120GBP - the cheapest I could find it for online - and I felt while it was expensive for what you got you do pay for convenience.
reviews.title: Convenient for Parc des Expos & CDG airport

reviews.text: Good points:
reviews.title: Close to the RER

reviews.text: - It was 1 stop from Paris CDG airport and walking distance from the metro station (and Parc des Expo) so no need for airport shuttle or taxi anywhere.
reviews.title: Best Hotel For The Price!!!!

reviews.text: - Rooms very clean, no sign of bedbugs. Cotton duvets, no horrible stained blankets in sight.
reviews.title: Interesting...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - we arrived late on a Sunday (10pm) and there was someone on reception
reviews.title: good hotel-- great price-- good location for airport

reviews.text: Why do we fail to believe others' TERRIBLE reviews? Maybe we think that we are much more experienced travelers with a wider comfort range, have slept on ant hills in an electric storm in the desert and enjoyed it? That is the only possible explanation for booking this room. The rational excuse was an early CDG flight. The truth is: we'd have been better off sleeping in the Business Class lounge. Good luck finding this place. NO ONE at the "Business Parc" speaks English or German or Spanish. Even with instructions by telephone from the next-door hotel check-in desk at the Kyriad, you will drag your roller bag up and down stair cases, over ankle-breaking cobblestones. And we arrived in daylight! Imagine doing it at night! And forget a wake-up call. There is no phone in this room. But BEWARE! There IS a shower faucet that will take a chunk out of your hand when you hit the faucet in panic to turn off the scalding water that comes out of the shower at first drop. I am still wearing a bandage.
reviews.title: Shoot me now!

reviews.text: If there was a plus, it was the spectacular African costume fashion parade of our fellow-passengers from the outlying suburbs on the way into Paris. Everyone was scrubbed and bejeweled with fresh coiffures (and this was the men...you can just imagine the women!) greeting each other in what was obviously a weekly ritual. Of course, that has nothing to do with the dump that is the Premiere Classe (!) Roissy-Villepinte-Parc des Expositions.
reviews.title: Bargain stay near CDG

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, but clean and adequate for an overnight close to the airport before an early departure, after a late arrival, or an unplanned overnight due to a missed/canceled flight. Parc des Expositions is a completely uninteresting locale, but is only one RER stop from CDG, and this hotel is right across the street from the RER station. The reception closes at night, but late arrivals are accommodated at the Hotel Kyriad Roissy reception, in the same building, 24 hours a day. The price I paid was 29 euros, an astounding bargain. If you insist on a bigger room, try the Kyriad in the same building, no doubt more expensive but I don't know how much.
reviews.title: Premiere Classe Roissy-Villepinte-Parc des Expositions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Could not get on to the internet. One hand and one bath towel for two of us.When we arrived someone should have been at reception had to go next door to collect our keys.There is two lifts only one was working.Breakfast was horrible.Room very small.
reviews.title: horrible, needs a negative rating. not worthy for any positive remark or score

reviews.text: horrible room, no carpet, metal bed from the 50's, requested non smoking but got put in smoking room which was awful. to top it all up, while sleeping another guest managed to use her key card to open my room door and got in!!!!!!! this a below budget hotel that is not safe at all and i would not reccommend it to anyone
reviews.title: Felt unsafe. Nice lobby, not a nice room; similar to a hostel.

reviews.text: If you're travelling by air, you may want to choose a hotel closer to the airport. This hotel doesn't offer a shuttle service. You have to take the train. Two stations, 3.75 euro. No attendant at the guichet, so you have to buy your ticket at the machine. It doesn't take bills, and it doesn't accept a Canadian Mastercard (!) I got to the hotel at 10:30 pm. No reception clerk! Had to go to the hotel next door (KYRIAD) to check-in. The room and washroom were tiny. Breakfast was 4.80 euro, and it was ok, basic. There was a line and people were nervous, since they had to take the train to go the airport. No one at the hotel would change my 20 euro bill to get change for my train ticket! For the same price you can stay at a bettter hotel closer to the airport and with a shuttle service.
reviews.title: Avoid it!

reviews.text: Nice hotel near near the airport. Price and quality match each other.
reviews.title: Cosy hotel near the airport

reviews.text: Bathroom is small and somehow was more like a "capsule bathroom".
reviews.title: Pleasently surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you arrive late - please go to Kyriad hotel reception next door to check in (the "automatic check-in system" is a myth, I guess).
reviews.title: Cheap hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a perfect joyce if you have to stay for a one or few nights, but I wouldn't recommend it for a longer stay - it's nicer to stay in Paris than near the airport if you're going on vacation.
reviews.title: Cheap hotel near the airport,perfect location if you fly early

aka: Premiere Classe Roissy-Villepinte-Parc Des Expositions Hotel
